Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: Gamma 1-H adopts a well-defined triple-stranded antiparallel beta-sheet (residues 1-6, 31-34, and 39-47), an alpha-helix (residues 16-28), and the corresponding connecting loops. Three disulfide bridges are located in the hydrophobic core holding together the alpha-helix and the beta-sheet and forming a cysteine-stabilized alpha-helical (CSH) motif.
Sequence Information.Function: Inhibits protein translation in cell-free systems.
Sequence Information.Caution: Was initially thought to be a thionin.

Literature.Title: Primary structure and inhibition of protein synthesis in eukaryotic cell-free system of a novel thionin, gamma-hordothionin, from barley endosperm.
Literature.Author: Mendez E, Moreno A, Colilla F.J, Pelaez F, Limas G.G, Mendez R, Soriano F, Salinas M, de Haro C.
